context: The Estonian word 'kohtunik' means judge, referee, or umpire. It refers to someone who has the authority to make decisions in legal proceedings (judge) or in sports competitions (referee/umpire). The word can be used for both male and female officials, and it follows standard Estonian grammar rules with different forms like 'kohtuniku' (genitive case meaning 'of the judge') and 'kohtunike' (partitive/plural form).
